section.title: Pull, push and fetch
section.para: You can use the Git Repositories view to pull, push and fetch to remote repositories. Right click on your repository and select the appropriated operation.

section.title: Basic team operations
section.para: Once you have placed a project under version control you can start using team operations on your project. The team operations are available via right-click on your project or file.

tip.para: The Team menu is also available from the context menu of an opened editor.

section.para: The most important operations are described in the following list. Select:

listitem.para:
Team Add to index
, to add the selected resource(s) to the Git index

Team Commit
, to open the commit dialog to create a new commit

Team Create Patch...
, to create a patch

Team Apply Patch...
, to apply a patch to your file system

Team Ignore
, to add a file to the .gitignore file

Team Show in History
, to display the history of the selected resources(s)

section.title: Team operations available on the project
section.para: If you select a project you can use additional team operations from the context menu.

listitem.para:
Team Pull
to pull in changes from your remote Git repository

Team Fetch
to fetch the current state from the remote repository

Team Switch To
to checkout existing or create new branches

Team Push
to push changes to your remote Git repository

Team Tag
to create and manage tags.

section.title: Amending a commit
section.para: Git amend allows adjusting the last commit. For example you can change the commit message or add another modification.
